text: Hello Jenkins, welcome back. Dagon wants to speak with you immediately
Jenkins! We finally finished preparations to mine the roots of the Giant Tree
I'm assigning you as head of the project
left_text: Ok, what do I have to do?

text: Those damn regulators will only let us dig five sectors
That's not all... We also have to work with some stupid geologist
It's actually "arborist", Dagon.
Nice to meet you, my name is Quinn and I am an expert on trees
left_text: I hope you won't be a pain
right_text: I'm looking forward to working with you

text: # SE sector
Our analysis suggest that we can try to mine some of the roots of the Giant Tree to study it without any risks.
We could start from the South East sector. This way we are away from the city's eyes and avoid any unnecessary fuss.
right_text: Why would we want to hide?

text: We're not hiding, we are just cautious
I agree about the South East sector, it is a good idea to start from a corner and have less impact on the tree
It all seems to have gone nicely. There is no risk for the tree.
# Decision 1
I've looked at the situation and the North and Eastern sectors are dangerous to mine
Hold on! The other sectors are too close to the city. I don't want another PR nightmare
left_text: Ok, we mine north to the Eastern sector then
right_text: Let's be safe and go west to the Southern sector

text: # E sector
I've already had everything prepared. We can start digging in the Eastern sector immediately.
left_text: If it has to be, let's go there
right_text: What are you still waiting for

text: Things seem very good. The Eastern sector is giving us very good returns.
left_text: Happy to hear the good news

text: The tree is still stable, but we can see that some branches are starting to dry. This is a very worrying sign
right_text: Do you think it's very bad?

text: Of course the tree is fine. Let's move on to the North Eastern sector. I feel it is full of gold
right_text: Can we afford to continue now?

text: Hard to know. It's not many branches that are suffering, but it is an early sign.
right_text: We need to be very careful

text: Of course there's nothing wrong with the Giant Tree. It will outlive us all.
Ok, we will be careful, but now let's move to the North Eastern sector.
I'd be very careful with that.
right_text: Let's move on and keep digging

text: Let's keep on digging... North East it is.
We dig North or we dig North. Even if we try digging in a different direction we risk getting in trouble with protests.
left_text: If North East is what you want, this is what you will get

text: # NE sector
The North Eastern sector is very rocky. We broke two of our diggers until we managed to mine it successfully. We cannot afford digging at such cost.
left_text: I shouldn't have listened to Dagon
right_text: Quinn, give me an update on the tree

text: The dried branches are expanding, but I expected worse
right_text: At least it seems to be slowing down

text: I wouldn't say so, but given what we're doing, it is a sort of good news.
left_text: Ok, so now we need to pick the next sector
right_text: Is there anything we could do for it, other than stop mining?

text: Ok, you managed to convince me that it's better heading south.
left_text: South sector it is, let's get going

text: Maybe we can try not to expand the current mine, but maybe try approaching it from the North West?
left_text: We must finish up here first

text: Our job is mining, and that's what we need to do. Let's mine in the North Western sector, this sector is next to the slums. The activists don't care about the slums.
left_text: South sector it is, let's get going
right_text: I don't know. Quinn, do you have any ideas?

text: # NW
It seems to be going well. It was a bit rocky, but the machines chewed the rocks like waffers
right_text: How much longer do you need?

text: They are almost done. Let's start planning our next move
Let's go with the Northern sector
right_text: Let's see what Quinn has to say

text: We've already dug the crucial sectors. It's dangerous to go for this one
left_text: I'm paid to finish my job. We move on!
right_text: We have one more sector, we cannot give up now.

text: Ok, let's dig the Western Sector. This way the Giant Tree will be balanced.
left_text: Let's avoid the activists. Let's go north

text: Then let's get started with the Northern sector
# Northern
We dig the northern sector
# Western sector
We dig the western sector
# Endgame
They are preparing to evacuate the city. Dagon seems to be fleeing the country.
The activists have surrounded our headquarters. We are stopping all operations.
Good job! We mined as much as we could. Dagon said you'll be getting a fat bonus.
